intro: Limodorum unifolium, commonly known as the single-leaved lily of the valley, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the forests of Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its solitary, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped white flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15–30 cm and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers emit a sweet, spicy fragrance, attracting pollinators such as bees and flies. Limodorum unifolium is often found in woodland habitats and is valued for its ornamental beauty and ecological significance.
